org.efaps.admin.datamodel

Interface IAttributeType

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IMultipleAttributeType
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFileType, AbstractLinkType, AbstractType, AbstractWithUoMType, BitEnumType, BlobType, BooleanType, CompanyLinkType, ConsortiumLinkType, CreatedType, CreatorLinkType, DateTimeType, DateType, DecimalType, DecimalWithUoMType, EnumType, FormatedStringType, GroupLinkType, IntegerType, IntegerWithUoMType, JaxbType, LinkType, LinkWithRanges, LongType, ModifiedType, ModifierLinkType, MultiLineArrayType, OIDType, OwnerLinkType, PasswordType, PersonLinkType, RateType, RealType, StatusType, StringType, StringWithUoMType, TimeType, TypeType

    public interface IAttributeType
extends Serializable
    Classes which implements this interface are used to handle the mapping of attributes between eFaps and the database.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    The eFaps Team

    • Method Detail

      • prepareUpdate

        void prepareUpdate(SQLUpdate _update,
                 Attribute _attribute,
                 Object... _values)
                   throws SQLException
        The method prepares the statement for update the object in the database.
        Parameters:
        _update - SQL update statement
        _attribute - attribute which is updated
        _values - new object value to set; values are localized and are coming from the user interface
        Throws:
        SQLException - if preparation for the update failed

      • prepareInsert

        void prepareInsert(SQLInsert _insert,
                 Attribute _attribute,
                 Object... _values)
                   throws SQLException
        The method prepares the statement for insert the object in the database.
        Parameters:
        _insert - SQL insert statement
        _attribute - attribute which is inserted
        _values - new object value to set; values are localized and are coming from the user interface
        Throws:
        SQLException - if preparation for the insert failed

      • readValue

        Object readValue(Attribute _attribute,
               List<Object> _objectList)
                 throws EFapsException
        Method is used to read the values, retrieved from an JDBC result set and put into the given parameter _objectList. This is necessary, because only in the different instances of this interface it can be determined what to do with the objects from the database. e.g. in case of DateTimeType the values will be cased into a DateTime Object and in case of a PersonLinkType a Person or Role instance will be returned. This method is called from the PrintQuery.
        Parameters:
        _attribute - related attribute which is read
        _objectList - list of objects from the eFaps Database
        Returns:
        Object as needed for eFaps
        Throws:
        EFapsException - on error

      • toString4Where

        String toString4Where(Object _value)
                      throws EFapsException
        Method is called when the value of the related attribute is used as argument in a where clause for a query. This is necessary because for the different attribute types the string representation must be generated different, e.g a datetime must be converted in an iso string etc.
        Parameters:
        _value - value to be returned as a string
        Returns:
        string representation of the value
        Throws:
        EFapsException - on error

      • valiate4Update

        void valiate4Update(Attribute _attribute,
                  Instance _instance,
                  Object[] _value)
                    throws EFapsException
        Method is executed on addition of an Attribute/Value pair for an Update on an Instance to validate if the value is permitted. Must throw the exception if not valid.
        Parameters:
        _attribute - the Attribute that will be updated with the _value
        _instance - Instance that will be updated
        _value - value that will be used for the update
        Throws:
        EFapsException - if not valid

      • valiate4Insert

        void valiate4Insert(Attribute _attribute,
                  Instance _instance,
                  Object[] _value)
                    throws EFapsException
        Method is executed on addition of an Attribute/Value pair for an Insert on an Instance to validate if the value is permitted. Must throw the exception if not valid.
        The given instance is expected to be invalid, but must contain the type.
        Parameters:
        _attribute - the Attribute that will be updated with the _value
        _instance - Instance that will be updated
        _value - value that will be used for the update
        Throws:
        EFapsException - if not valid
